boardgame.name: Squabblin Goblins
boardgame.description:
Goblins just can’t resist shiny things. These little schemers will stop at nothing to end up with the biggest hoard of gold and treasure. From sharpened forks to secret bombs, everything goes with these greedy goblins!

Welcome to Squabblin' Goblins, a two player game of secrets and deduction. In this game, you play as competing goblins trying to get the best loot. You’ll each end up with three piles at the end of the game, but watch out - the piles on your side of the field could end up empty, or even worth negative points!


Emma Larkins's game Heartcatchers caught our eye so many years ago. It was only 21 cards, just outside of our wallet limits. But Emma took the core game and cut it down to 18 cards and changed the adorable hearts into adorable goblins. This one plays 2, and it is quite the competitive little game of sneakily messing with each other.

—description from the publisher

BattleTech: Strategic Operations – Advanced Aerospace Rules

boardgame.name: Sakura Narabu
さな (Sana)
桜儷 (Sana)
boardgame.description:
桜儷 (さな) (Sana) is a 2-player co-operative game from Japan. Players are apprentice Spring fairies, tasked with bringing the cherry blossom (Sakura) to flower. Both fairies don't want to let on that they are apprentice, and so do not talk as they work. The more flowers they can make bloom, they better they succeed.

The game title Sana is a contraction Sakura Narabu, meaning Line Up Blossoms. The kanji 儷 (Narabu) is remarkably obscure. Hence the publisher has added the more simple hiragana さな to help readers as a furigana (pronunciation indicator).

The board shows ten open spaces for Sakura, each space being for five petals. Players will build up complete flowers on the spaces to win.

Each player has a number of petal pieces, showing 1 to 4 petals. They secretly take a petal in hand and show them together, without discussing what they are choosing.

If they have chosen different pieces, then they each place their chosen petals on the board. But an existing piece must be taken off the board to a storage area.

If they have chosen the same pieces to play (butting), again they place their pieces, but may now bring a piece from the storage area onto the board.

When places their pieces, the players can talk so to get optimal placement. But they cannot discuss what pieces they have left, not what to choose next turn.

There are also some placement conditions depending upon the number of petals. For example, a 3 petal piece can only go to an empty space.

Once a flower is complete, it cannot be changed. Pieces that cannot be placed are returned to hand.

The game ends in certain ways:
When a player runs out of pieces.
When all ten flowers are complete.
When the storage area has five pieces.

Then the players see how many flowers they have completed and praise or chastise themselves accordingly.
user summary

boardgame.name: Moving Pictures: Dinosaur Outbreak!
boardgame.description:
Spirits are high at the studio, coming off the success of your first major release. But as you run out of awards to win and crew members to toast, there's one question on everyone's mind: can you pull it off a second time?

The director says she wants the next film to be bolder, riskier, and more challenging to the audience. You're skeptical, but she assures you there's no reason to worry: if it doesn't test well, we can fix it with a secret weapon she likes to call "reshoots."

The cameras are rolling on our newest blockbuster: Moving Pictures: Dinosaur Outbreak! This cooperative game for 2 players was designed by Chris Klimowski and is sure to be a big hit.

In Moving Pictures: Dinosaur Outbreak! players take turns placing numbered scene cards from their hand into the shared Timeline row in hopes of getting all 6 cards in order. The catch? They can't speak or signal to each other, so they'll have to watch each other's play closely for clues. Each card also has an effect listed which can impact placement, swap cards around, or even allow players a rare opportunity to share information.

Getting it right once is a feat in itself but a full game of Moving Pictures: Dinosaur Outbreak! is played over 3 Acts. The Timeline grows with each Act, making each round harder than the one before. Thankfully you also have access to 2 Deleted Scenes: if the round would end with scenes out of order, you can spend a Deleted Scene to hide one card. These Deleted Scenes don’t refresh, meaning that you only get 2 mistakes before the credits roll.

COMBINING GAMES
Dinosaur Outbreak! can be combined with another Moving Pictures game. If combining, choose one scene card each numbered 1-16 to play with, and any two Deleted Scene cards.

boardgame.name: Naturopolis
boardgame.description: First there were cities, then there were farms, and next up is nature! This will be the third (and final?) game in the core Sprawlopolis series. Expect some new twists, and expect new Combopolis sets to combine Naturopolis with Sprawlopolis and Agropolis.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Phantoms
boardgame.description: Experimental Tech Readout: Phantoms samples a number of high-technology designs developed for use by elite covert operatives and special military forces found throughout the Inner Sphere in the late-Jihad period. Each design featured in this book demonstrates the advanced and experimental technologies found in Tactical Operations. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units, and battlesuits presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: The Family Dinner
boardgame.description:
It's dinner time and you're spending it with family! Some of which you haven't seen in a long time. As we all know, big family dinners always bring chaos. Even the happiest of families get wacky during big gatherings.

In The Family Dinner you’ll be playing as a dysfunctional family, having dinner together for the first time in a while. Each player acts as a member of the family. Play takes place over a number of courses with Ingredient Cards being used to drive the conversation and to shape what food is served. As you play you will be drawing a family tree that includes all players and extended family. The family is all here, let's start eating!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Battletech: The Wars of Reaving – Supplemental
boardgame.description: The Wars of Reaving Supplemental also includes Random Assignment Tables for the Reaving era and beyond, a short Strana Mechty mini-campaign, and fifty-one record sheets of units used throughout the conflict, including new OmniMechs and ProtoMechs introduced in The Wars of Reaving sourcebook.

boardgame.name: Agemonia: Metal Coins
boardgame.description: This pack contains 110 Metal Coins in denominations of 1, 3, 5, 10, 20 and 50 for use in Agemonia.

boardgame.name: Agemonia: Miniatures Box
boardgame.description:
All the miniatures of Agemonia including all reached stretch goals of the Kickstarter in 2021.

These replace all monster standees in the game.

boardgame.name: Agemonia: Dice Pack
boardgame.description: This pack contains 8 dice (5 red and 3 blue D6).

boardgame.name: Panama Canal Trivia Game
boardgame.description:
This unique trivia challenge with a Panama Canal theme is designed to be enjoyed by up to four players.

Contestants roll a die to move around a pathway with spaces named for locations on or near the canal: Gatun Locks, Balboa, Gaillard Cut, etc. Question cards are color coded like playing cards: Ace, King, Queen, Jack, and Ten. The first player to obtain a "Royal Flush" is declared the winner.

Includes board, rules, question cards, tokens, a die, and information about the Panama Canal Museum.

boardgame.name: Safari-spel
boardgame.description:
Safari-spel is a roll and move game with a safari theme. Each round, roll a dice and move the number of squares it shows. If you end up in a square with an animal, read the instructions and follow it. First to the village in the middle of the game board wins.

Safari-spel was in the comic book "Musse Pigg & C: o" No. 2, February 1983. Musse Pigg is the swedish name for Mickey Mouse.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Bruderkampf
boardgame.description:
Bruderkampf was designed to teach new BattleTech players. It contains a mini-campaign (a series of six connected scenarios) of increasing complexity that do not require the players to possess any additional products beyond a single boxed BattleTech starter set.

The scenarios are designed to be played using only the maps and BattleMechs from the Introductory box.

boardgame.name: Time Travel Entertainment, Inc.
boardgame.description:
Humanity just discovered how to send robots anywhere in time and space! What do you do with such technology? Well you use it for multimedia entertainment of course! And so, the Time Travel Entertainment, Inc. was created. Oddly specific robots with even more specific abilities are sent across spacetime to bring you the finest entertainment.

In Time Travel Entertainment Inc. you will play as one of nine robots that are given a task to solve. Each setting is unique. to build a setting you just answer 3 questions: Where are they? When are they? and What are they trying to do? Using their three character cards players will solve the problem at hand limited only in scope by the players’ own imaginations to entertain the humans of the future.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Role Playing Wallet Line (Button Shy)

boardgame.name: Shades of Ink
boardgame.description:
After coming into possession of a stack of old psychological inkblot tests, you discover that the accompanying notes hint at something unnerving - they imply that the ink has power and that the blots hold trapped spirits that feed, somehow, on the viewer's psychic energy...

Shades of Ink is a solo role playing game where you will look at inkblots, note what you see, and then fight to destroy the shades that manifest from your visions. As you accumulate knowledge, the spirits' power also accumulates until it coalesces to form one final encounter.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Role Playing Wallet Line (Button Shy)

boardgame.name: Western Legends: Traveling Trader Miniature Upgrade
boardgame.description: Upgrade your Traveling Trader token to this fancy "Rolling Emporium" miniature.

boardgame.name: Disney's-Jubileumsspel
boardgame.description:
Place "Kalles Kalas"-cards in a pile with the collector image side up. Roll the dice and move. If you end up on a question symbol, the player on the left must pick up a card and read the question with the same symbol in front. If you answer correctly, you have to roll the die again and move. If you answer incorrectly, you must remain in that circle and the next player in turn must roll the die. When a card has been used, it is placed back at the bottom of the pile. If you end up in a red circle, the next player will have to choose which category you must answer. Nothing happens on yellow circles. First in goal wins.

The game was included in "Kalle Anka & C: o", No. 16, April 18, 1994. Kalle Anka is the swedish name for Donald Duck.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Interstellar Expeditions – Interstellar Players 3
boardgame.description:
Nearly fifteen years have passed since the end of the Word of Blake Jihad and the rise of the Republic of the Sphere. Yet even as the Inner Sphere adjusts to a new sense of normalcy, questions remain about whether the Blakist threat is gone for good or merely hibernating.

Once a disorganized collective of hobbyists and academics backed by the idle wealthy, Interstellar Expeditions has emerged from the fires of war to take up the mission once claimed by ComStar's Explorer Corps: to search for the elusive hiding places where humanity's enemies might have gone. From the dead worlds within the borders of the Inner Sphere itself, to the distant, uncharted reaches of the Deep Periphery, IE relentlessly searches for the answers to mysteries dating back to mankind's first ventures into deep space, while simultaneously watching for any sign of the zealots who so recently waged the most horrendous interstellar war in modern history.

Interstellar Expeditions: Interstellar Players 3 describes the organization and efforts of Interstellar Expeditions as it continues to search within (and beyond) human-occupied space in the BattleTech universe. First introduced in Interstellar Players, IE's operations have now gone truly universal, seeking answers and treasures not only from the lost and forgotten worlds of humanity's distant past, but also the distant colonies and civilizations that have risen--and even fallen--beyond the boundaries of the Inner Sphere. Gamemasters and players can decide which of these groups and discoveries may actually bear fruit, and which are the misdirections left behind by the surviving leaders of the Blakist war machine. Whether from this sourcebook or the gamemaster's own imagination, these discoveries can become the ultimate villain, ally, or unique new setting for any type of BattleTech campaign!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
Classic BattleTech: Jihad Conspiracies – Interstellar Players 2

boardgame.name: BattleTech: HexPack – Promotion 1
boardgame.description: The HexPacks are a flexible map system aid from the BattleTech game system. Designed for use in conjunction with other pre-printed mapsheets (such as those for the 25th Anniversary Introductory Box Set), the systems flexibility allows for easy modifications to existing mapsheets, increasing the enjoyment of a given scenario as players quickly change the terrain to bring new excitement to each game they play!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: CARDtographer: Cooperative Storytelling Adventure
boardgame.description:
Tired of game nights that end with frustration, or staring at boring screens? Introducing CARDtographer, the collaborative storytelling card game for legendary heroes!

Enter a new world of adventure where you and your friends join forces with mighty heroes to create a map exploring the vibrant fantasy world of Terrath! Stand against dastardly villains, and cleanse your corruption, to stop the vile dragon Luxian from destroying the world! Trade cards and tell stories inspired by unique card prompts, but be ready for when Luxian swoops down to raid your lands! Play as 6 unique hero classes with world-saving abilities. Enjoy laughs, intrigue, infinite replay, and story variety! Easy to learn fun to play. Now is your time to fight the dragon, not each other!

Players work together to create a world map (3x3 card square) by telling exploration adventure stories before the evil dragon Luxian destroys the world!

On your turn, draw a card, and then you may choose to do one of the following:

1. Trade - Trade one Story card (Hero, Villain, or Location) for another player’s Story card.
2. Cleanse - Remove a Corruption card from your hand by discarding it and a matching “cleansing” Hero card.
3. Explore - Tell a solo story exploring a land by combining one of each Story card type (Hero, Villain, and Location).
4. Raid - Instantly join forces with all the other players to tell a combined story standing against a random raid attack by the evil dragon Luxian!

The game ends when every player has told at least one solo story, and all 9 “map” slots are filled with cards. Explored Locations, failed Raids, and Corruption cards form a 3x3 grid on the table, completing your map. The group scores (1) victory point for each successfully explored Location card. If the majority of the 9 cards are successfully explored Locations, the heroes are victorious! If all 9 are successfully explored Locations, celebrate a perfect victory as top tier “CARDtographers”!

boardgame.name: Tiger Stripes: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
Long ago a great mother tigress had four cubs. After many days she instructed her growing tigers, "Go out into the far reaches of the world and seek your fortunes. Hunt for prey to earn your stripes and become powerful. Have many wonderful adventures.

Players are tiger cubs trying to earn their stripes by capturing matching sets of Prey Cards. This is done by drawing cards from the deck and trading cards from their hand to match gems on the cards. The first player to place seven stripes on their player card is the winner

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Historical – Reunification War
boardgame.description:
In 2570, the six Great Houses of the Inner Sphere united to create the Star League, promising to bring an end to the generations of warfare that engulfed the worlds mankind now called home. Shortly thereafter, to seal their alliance, they turned against the various independent realms of the Periphery. Over the next twenty years, the so-called Reunification War would rage, claiming more lives than the savagery of the Age of War before it, all to realize House Cameron's dream of a united humanity--at any cost.

Historical: Reunification War describes the first grand military campaign of the newborn Star League against the collected realms of the Periphery. Covering each of the four major campaign theaters in detail, this book provides a hard look at the formative years of the first Star League, and the fateful decisions that led them to usher in a new Golden Age for mankind by unleashing their armies against its most far-flung worlds.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Merciless Minions Pack #1
boardgame.description:
You can't conquer a planet without an army! The forces of the Machine Empire and Ransik's mutants are here and hellbent on attacking humanity. These foot soldiers might not be so tough individually, but a swarm of them will prove a handful for any Ranger. Enemy bosses rely on their merciless minions to batter the Power Rangers’ defenses and soften them up for the monstrous heavy hitters.

The Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Merciless Minions Pack #1 expansion pack includes the Machine Empire's Cogs and Ransik's Cyclobots, as well as an alternate Putty Patroller enemy deck representing Lord Zedd's terrifying Chaos Putties!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: When Gods Collide
boardgame.description:
This is a fantasy themed 4-player version of MetaCheckers: Battlefield with all-wood, laser cut pieces. Play as one of four ancient gods:
• Zeus / Greek temples
• Odin / viking ships
• Amun-Ra / sphinxes
• Marduk / Babylonian ziggurats

Each player gets 6 board tiles - four squares each - which they take turns placing on the field of play, connecting the tiles to form a unique battlefield. Players place their 12 checkers strategically on the squares of their tiles, with the kings hidden, face down at the beginning of the game. Eliminate your opponents by capturing their god / king.

On their turn, players roll two dice to determine how to move a checker. One die has the symbols for chess pieces, the other is a standard d6 numbers die. Whenever a 6 is rolled, the player may opt to reroll with the HERO Die and the numbers die for 6 additional useful moves.

Players eliminate their opponents by capturing the hidden god / king of the opposing army, which then leaves the board. Last player standing wins.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Era Report – 3062
boardgame.description: Era Report: 3062 describes the state of the Inner Sphere and the Clans at a divisive period in BattleTech history: the latter years of the Clan Invasion. Presented as a general overview of the period, rather than a focused report on a single conflict, this book includes descriptions of many major Inner Sphere, Periphery, and Clan factions. Notable personalities, military forces, and an overview of the technological capabilities of the Inner Sphere and Clan powers of this critical period in history are also provided, along with special advanced-level rules for campaigns set in this era, whether played using the Total Warfare core rules or those found in A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Handbook – Major Periphery States
boardgame.description: Handbook: Major Periphery States collates the essential history, politics and culture of the Major Periphery States into a single volume. More than a mere sourcebook, Handbook: Major Periphery States provides rules for both BattleTech and A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG game play, including new support vehicles, creatures and more!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Handbook – House Kurita
boardgame.description: Handbook: House Kurita cover the pivotal history, politics and cultures of the Inner Sphere's most feared Great Houses. Not just a sourcebook, Handbook: House Kurita covers rules for both BattleTech and A Time of War game play, including such areas as personal equipment, support vehicles, creatures and more.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Conan: The Conqueror – Stretch Goals Box
boardgame.description:
Some of these miniatures were already included in the Mythic Battles: Pantheon game, so contributors to the Conan: The Conqueror Kickstarter were allowed to choose which ones they wanted in their Stretch Goals box. Other Stretch Goals (additional activation tiles, the seventh Adventure Mode scenario, and the Overlord sheets for the miniatures) were integrated into the finished products (the Conan: The Conqueror box and its accompanying book of scenarios, the Tome of Skelos).

A full Stretch Goals box contains five miniatures:

Hydra (from Mythic Battles: Pantheon)
Nameless Horror (Typhon from Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Rise of the Titans)
Servant of Ahriman (The Scourge from Claustrophobia)
Son of Set (Python from Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Pandora's Box)
Winged One (Winged Ape from Corinthia: A Conan / Mythic Battles – Pantheon Crossover)


Someone who had previously purchased Mythic Battles: Pantheon and its expansions would get all the new material by purchasing just the Conan: The Conqueror core box. This accessory Stretch Goals box was thus meant for fans of Conan who did not get Mythic Battles.

670 g, 30×29.5×13 cm

boardgame.name: Alvora Tactics
boardgame.description: From the Developer's Webpage: "Alvora Tactics is an indie Tactics RPG that combines strategic combat with immersive exploration. Explore and conquer Great Serpent Alvora with your own customizable band of warriors!"

boardgame.name: Lacuna
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Lacuna is a 2D sci-fi noir adventure where your choices matter.

boardgame.name: 8 Doors
8Doors: Arum's Afterlife Adventure
boardgame.description:
8Doors is Metroidvania style 2D action platformer game based on Korean afterlife world view. Explore 8 different area of purgatory by becoming the main character 'Arum'. Solve the mystery of happening on purgatory through fight against the specter and lead fugitive souls to the right path.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Mirror Mirror
boardgame.description:
"Tired and weary adventurers seek refuge in a cabin in the woods, only this cabin is not what it seems. This adventure takes a group of level 3 players on a trip to the darkerside of the Feywild.

This is an adventure written as part of the RPG writing course."

(User Summary)

boardgame.name: Greak: Memories of Azur
boardgame.description:
Greak: Memories of Azur is a side scrolling single-player game with hand-drawn animations. You will take the role of three siblings: Greak, Adara and Raydel to guide them through the lands of Azur. Alternate control between them and use their unique abilities to escape from the Urlag invasion.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: TOHU
boardgame.description:
TOHU is a brand new adventure game set amongst a world of weird and wonderful fish planets. Explore beautiful environments and solve intricate puzzles as a little girl, joined by her mechanical alter-ego, Cubus. Together they will discover the truth about themselves and the mysterious Sacred Engine that powers their world.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Dragon Age: Inquisition – Spoils of the Avvar
boardgame.description: The Avvar make formidable foes, and potentially powerful allies, in Dragon Age: Inquisition. With the Spoils of the Avvar item pack, you can now bring elements of their fiercely independent culture into your Inquisition. Personalize your game experience with new loot, new customization options for Skyhold, and the Avvar mount pack, which contains five war-painted beasts to ride into battle!

boardgame.name: Dragon Age: Inquisition – Spoils of the Qunari
boardgame.description: The Spoils of the Qunari content pack adds new items to your Inquisition, inspired by the style of Par Vollen! Bring the Qun to Skyhold with several options that represent your dedication to discipline, from a massive warrior throne to various sculptures honoring the Qunari people. The Spoils of the Qunari content pack also includes two sets of unique armor as loot, including an Arishok armor set, as well as schematics to craft new pieces for your party members. Ride across Thedas atop an armored war mount and vanquish your enemies in the name of the Qun!

boardgame.name: Lost Eons: Haven of Aves
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A setting for LOST EONS based in a future Liverpool, an avian world of haves and have-nots. Featuring Art by Harriet Burns and a short story by Gabrielle de la Puente, enter a future world of water, misery and defiance.

Working with students at the Liverpool School of Art and Design at Liverpool John Moores University, Gabrielle de la Puente and David Blandy have created a future vision of Liverpool after climate collapse, that eerily echoes our own.

LOST EONS is solarpunk sci-fantasy. In Lost Eons you will emerge from the darkness into a new light, one dominated by inscrutable and terrible forces you must seek to understand. Using this guide create a post-human character in the Aves setting, ready to face the mysteries and dangers of a far future Earth.

boardgame.name: Old Man Winter
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A small corner of the world has become blanketed by an endless winter.

For over a year now, crops have died and people have been driven from their homes to seek warmer climes. Rumours, however, have begun to speak that in the dead centre of the eternal snow is an abandoned town overtaken by ice, with a glowing artefact at its heart. If anyone is to save this land, they now have a good place to start…

'Old Man Winter' is a one-page fantasy adventure designed to be system neutral and compatible with any tabletop RPG, including Heartbreaker.

boardgame.name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Foot Soldier Promo Pack #1
boardgame.description:
Lord Drakkon conquered his alternate world with an army of Rangers under his control. Use this alternate combat deck for the Mastodon Troopers to give the Rangers a greater challenge.

Includes a 10 card combat deck for Ranger Sentries, intended for use with the Mastodon Trooper miniatures from the Shattered Grid expansion.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid

boardgame.name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Zord Pack #2
boardgame.description:
Reclaim the legendary Shogunzords from Lord Zedd and his minions, in order to field their ancient might against your adversaries.

Includes:
Black Shogunzord card
White Shogunzord card
Blue Shogunzord card
Yellow Shogunzord card
Red Shogunzord card
Shogun Megazord card
Shogun Ultrazord card

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid

boardgame.name: Parallel Worlds (Issue 26 - Q4 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Parallel Worlds is relaunching its new quarterly, TTRPG-centric format! This holiday season, immerse yourself in smart, creative content on the world of tabletop gaming.

We have D&D, of course, but also Warhammer, Chivalry & Sorcery, and more. We include interviews, ready-made encounters, and stories from actual gaming tables. In addition, we’ve doubled the length of our publication to reach 100 pages, while maintaining our high writing and design standards! You don’t want to miss this incarnation of the best in the world of tabletop gaming.

boardgame.name: Exoduster Sheriff
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Savage Worlds RPG release brings you the Exoduster Sheriff Old West Archetype. This ready-to-go character build provides a basis for developing a former slave Exoduster who has taken on the role of local sheriff to bring law and justice to those who have been so long denied it.

Each Old West Archetype delivers the basic build, plus ideas for some typical roles the character may fill, variations you may want to explore, and more.

boardgame.name: Evil Rising
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Evil Unleashed

Evil Rising is a collection of seven exciting adventures for Icons Superpowered Roleplaying, introducing heroes to a variety of villains and their sinister schemes:


Grudge Match: The heroes come between to destructive powerhouses before they can destroy downtown.
Danger in Dunsmouth: Horror in a seaside town as a trio of witches see to raise an ancient monster from the deep.
Jailbreak! A test of a new super-prison becomes a death-trap at the hands of the Killer Gamemaster.
Murder of Crowes: The mysterious murder of a rural teenager leads to a spree of sinister attacks.
The RetConQuest: Heroes in an alternate timeline need to learn their true identities and overcome a villain who has changed history.
The Sidereal Schemes of Dr. Zodiac: Can the heroes prevent Dr. Zodiac from assembling the full power of all twelve of the Zodiac Gems?
The Skeletron Key: The theft of a military super-weapon leads the heroes to discover an even greater threat.


Hours of excitement and adventure as your Icons heroes overcome the threat of Evil Rising!

boardgame.name: No ArtPunk Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

"The following is a compilation containing the eight best entries of the universally celebrated and critically-acclaimed No Artpunk competition. You will find therein no fancy layouts, graphic design high-school projects, goofy ideas or political finger-wagging. Instead the talents of these chosen few have been devoted to that highest achievement: the creation of great adventures using oldschool rulesystems. The contestants were restricted to using only those creatures, spells and items they could find in the published body of oldschool D&D, with one exception, being allowed one item, monster and spell each. The results speak for themselves. The volume includes adventures for Rules Compendium, OSRIC, ACKS, Labyrinth Lord, OSE and Worlds Without Number or their closest oldschool counterparts. The proceeds for this will be donated to the Autism Research Institute for 3 months, after which it will become freely available.

Glory to the OSR!"

boardgame.name: Stick 'Em Up
boardgame.description:
A western outlaw game where you draw from two decks, racing to accumulate 50 total gold.

Players take turns drawing cards, laying gold bag cards face up and leaving any others in their hands. This is where the element of cheating comes in, you only have to reveal your hand if someone draws The Jig is Up card, then all players reveal the hands and pay their debts/loss of turns.

This is the second edition of the game. I added what was to be the first expansion to just be part of the base game, adding an additional 54 cards that really brings the "bad guy" feel to the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ringfrei
boardgame.description:
Each player starts with 5 colored rings on his game piece, which should move from there to the personal ring tray as quickly as possible. To do this, questions about the topics of body, mind and soul must be answered and tasks must be solved. Through wrong answers and events you have to put new rings on your figure. The first player to collect at least 8 rings on his ring tray and only carry a maximum of 2 rings on his game piece wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Some Kind of...
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For those moments when the characters come across something unexpected, and the only way you can describe it is, "It's some kind of..."

As a Gamemaster, you can’t have something planned for every eventuality. For example, perhaps you have to step in to run something on short notice, or the normal group can’t meet, so you want something to change the pace.

Some Kind of... offers a simple system for creating scene hooks, set dressing, and random red herrings perfect for your next session of space opera or a not-too-hard sci-fi. A gathering of random tables provides a springboard for your creativity when you need it most.

Check out the Table of Contents preview, an introduction, and the first page of random goodness.

It's a GM resource for those moments when you need some kind of...
boardgame.rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

boardgame.name: What's Next?: A life-size boardgame
boardgame.description:
It's What's Next? The game where you won't know what silly things you'll do to make it to the finish line. Will you cry like a baby? dance? sing? maybe fart? Get together with family and friends to play.

You'll be laughing for hours on end.

The Rules:


Each player rolls the die. The player that rolls the highest number goes first. You'll need at least two players.
All players begin on the "Start" tile.
Roll the die. Move ahead that number of tiles.
Where did you land? Follow the instructions on that tile.


FOR EXAMPLE:

If you land on tile #4, pretend you're driving a race car.
If you land on tile #10, go back to start.

Your turn has ended. Pass the die onto the next player.


Most important... Laugh and have fun!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Carcassonne: Scoring Flags
boardgame.description:
Now it's gonna be fancy! This is an official decoration item from Cundco (online distributor for Hans im Glück).

You can attach our new scoring flags directly to your Meeple on the scoring track. They always show you the current score. Simply add the points on the flag to the field on which your scoring Meeple is standing. There comes joy!

You will receive 5 flags: 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, 300 plus a scoring Meeple in the matching color. You can choose from 5 colors (red, yellow, blue, green and black) or get the flags untreated.

These are the official implementation of the Meeple Flags originally designed by The Game Crafter, LLC in 2019.

listing.notes:
Carcassonne scoring flags, red, green, black or blue available.
Yellow has been sold.
10 Euros is for 1 set of 6 flags and a meeple of one color. Order multiple times if you want more than one color, and PM me to specify which color you're interested in.
A meeple of the same color as the flags is included.

boardgame.name: Court of the Pixie King
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enchanted Meadows Await!

Enter the realm of the fairies, both bright and beautiful and dark and foreboding. A battle for the rule of all feydom is fought by the benevolent Seelie and the malign Unseelie. Who will win the crown and what role will your party play?

This book includes Fairy Lore, Fey and Gnome Expert Skills, New Reaction: Mischief, Two New Dungeon Tile Sets, New Classes (Faery and Bog Fly), New Monsters, Spells and Magic Items, Toadstool Rings and Tree Hollows, Enchanted Mushrooms, New Gnome Gadgets, Traits, Milestones, Mutations, Six New Druid Spells and a New Patron.

boardgame.name: Castles & Crusades Player Archive
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Castles & Crusades is an easy to learn role playing game, but even it could use some quick reference guides!

In the Player Archive, you will find just that, with all the classes presented in the C&C Players Handbook, C&C Adventurers Backpack and some from Amazing Adventures all in one convenient book. The entries in Character Classes are alphabetized for quick and easy reference.

It also includes a host of options for multi-classing your character! Most everyone wants an edge, an angle that allows them to take that extra step, achieve that extra goal, to surprise the enemy. This angle, in hard fought battles with certain loss, can turn and snatch victory from the jaws of disaster. Expanding Classes is just that angle. Herein we delve into the 13 standard C&C classes, and the Rune Mark, and unleash the power of multiclassing, enhanced classes and switching classes. Create new characters that combine the powers of several classes, or breathe life into old characters, long used to the campaign trail, by switching classes! Expand your game with Expanding Classes!

boardgame.name: Scions of the Computarchs: Supreme Thinker OHM-13
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scions of the Computarchs is a limited series of patron AIs suitable for use in high tech settings like Mutant Crawl Classics RPG, Cyber Sprawl Classics, Crawljammer, Umerica, Terror of the Stratosfiend, and Star Crawl. This inaugural issue documents the mysterious cult of the OHM-13. Inside is a full patron AI write-up, OHM-13 patron programs (1st - 3rd levels), and a player information handout and campaign advice.

Return to the glory days of science fiction gaming with the Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game. Adventure like it’s 1978 again, with modern rules grounded in the origins of post-apocalyptic role playing. Fast play, a mysterious future, and 100% compatibility with the DCC RPG system await you — just activate your artifact…
boardgame.rpg: Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Robot Revolution
boardgame.description:
Expansion contains:

- 19 Miniatures: 1x Intergalactic Ninja Assassin Claptrap, 4x Kamikaze Claptraps, 6x Punk-Stabby Claptraps, 8x Partisan Claptraps
- 40 new double sided game hexes
- All game cards needed to play
- Bounty scenarios
- Crush the Revolution campaign

–description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Loot-Splosion Campaign Supplement
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery

boardgame.name: Cartoon Network Crossover Crisis: Animation Annihilation Deck building game – Professor Utonium Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Cartoon Network Crossover Crisis: Animation Annihilation Deck building game - Professor Utonium Promo Card.

At the start of each of your turns you may put a card with cost 4 or less from your discard pile on the bottom of your deck.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Cartoon Network Crossover Crisis: Animation Annihilation Deck-Building Game

boardgame.name: Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion x Cat & Chocolate
boardgame.description:
Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion x Cat & Chocolate is a standalone game that uses the same gameplay as Cat & Chocolate with characters, items, and situations from the Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion anime.

Each turn, the active player must use 1-3 items in hand to avoid threats, creating a convincing story that incorporates these somewhat random objects. After you tell the story, everyone else votes on whether or not you succeeded. If a majority backs you, you keep the threat card; otherwise, you don't. Each player secretly belongs to either the CODE or the GEASS team, and you naturally want to vote for the players on your team, but no one knows who is on which team.

After a certain number of threats, the game ends, players reveal which team they belong to, and each team tallies the number of threats that their members escaped. Whichever side avoided more threats wins!

boardgame.name: Vomitations of the Grotesque Princess Issue #1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vomitations of the Grotesque Princess is an infamous zine from Brazil. Its is said that the writer lives in the middle of the jungle, feeds on acid every week and shapeshift into a person every now and then to wander throughout empty streets.

Seriously now, this zine is filled with TTRPG content that you can use with your favorite fantasy game. It works better with Old School Games, but with a little effort it is possible to convert the content to basically any type of game or setting. Part of its content is +18, so kids, please do not buys this! The zine uses the rules of Lamentations of the Flame Princess, which makes it full compatible with the system.

CONTENT
1. A Brief Text on Existentialism.
2. Detailed Description of Two NPCs.
3. A Grotesque Monster.
4. Five New Skills for OSR games.
5. A Ritual Generator Divided into Tables.

20 Pages of Madness!

boardgame.name: Vomitations of the Grotesque Princess Issue #2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vomitations of the Grotesque Princess is an infamous zine from Brazil. Its is said that the writer lives in the middle of the jungle, feeds on acid every week and shapeshift into a person every now and then to wander throughout empty streets.

Seriously now, this zine is filled with TTRPG content that you can use with your favorite fantasy game. It works better with Old School Games, but with a little effort it is possible to convert the content to basically any type of game or setting. Part of its content is +18, so kids, please do not buys this! The zine uses the rules of Lamentations of the Flame Princess, which makes it full compatible with the system.

CONTENT
1. A Hell of a Trip.
2. Creating Unique NPCs.
3. Magic Weapons Fundamentally Violent.
4. Dragons.
5. The I Don't Give a Fuck List.

boardgame.name: Vomitations of the Grotesque Princess Issue #3
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vomitations of the Grotesque Princess is an infamous zine from Brazil. Its is said that the writer lives in the middle of the jungle, feeds on acid every week and shapeshift into a person every now and then to wander throughout empty streets.

Seriously now, this zine is filled with TTRPG content that you can use with your favorite fantasy game. It works better with Old School Games, but with a little effort it is possible to convert the content to basically any type of game or setting. Part of its content is +18, so kids, please do not buys this! The zine uses the rules of Lamentations of the Flame Princess, which makes it full compatible with the system.

CONTENT
1. A Hell of a Trip.
2. Creating Unique NPCs.
3. Magic Weapons Fundamentally Violent.
4. Dragons.
5. The I Don't Give a Fuck List.

boardgame.name: Babar
boardgame.description:
A competitive memory game using a standard 52-card deck.

The goal is to be the player with the lowest score at the end of each round by exchanging cards face down with the other players. You can't look at a card and keep it at the same turn, so you better remember it!

The game ends as soons as one player reaches 77 points or more. The player with the lowest score wins!

boardgame.name: Rain-Bo
boardgame.description:
From the box:

Rain-Bo is the racing rainbow card where gray skies are going to clear up & you put on a happy face.

In Rain-Bo, players race to be the first to fill their hand with the seven colors of the rainbow.

To do this, they clear their clouds away & let the sun shine in by strategically swapping & saving cards!

There's no numbers, no complex rules, just fun for everyone!

___________________________________________

Play starters with a pile of cloud cards & each turn they select a sun card from the centre. The player then exchanges their cloud cards that match that sun cards color.

The first player to have a sun card of each color is the winner!

boardgame.name: Mysterium: Mask
boardgame.description: A mask that the ghost can wear during its turn for more immersion.

listing.notes:
New and sealed
Shipping will need to be in a box, to protect it from being crushed.
Please reach out for shipping quotes.

boardgame.name: Not Who They Seem
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nemesis: Not Who They Seem presents five unique NPCs that can serve as adversaries for your unsuspecting players. Each NPC is presented at multiple levels so that they can easily be added to your campaign. Whether you need a quick "replacement" villain because the players dispatched your main bad guy too soon, or you want to add some depth to your setting with side quests and adventures, these five charlatans will serve you well.

Russell Cobbler: A half-elf from a broken home who once dreamed of a life as bard. But the world never cared about his feelings, so now he manipulates the feelings of others to set them up for betrayal.

Lula Harper: The daughter of a noble's servant, Lula learned first hand how cruel and pointless the aristocracy really is. Now she masquerades amongst them in an effort to burn the entire oppressive system to the ground.

Milton the Alchemist: A temporary lapse of judgment sent this skill apothecary down his path of greed. Plying his schemes on those "with more coin than sense," Milton considers his crimes victimless. His victims might disagree.

Charlie Smith: After a horribly fumbled encounter with a green dragon, Charlie ended up with a cursed item that convinced him he was the greatest adventurer of all time. And he'll prove it, regardless of how many companions have to die in the process.

Annaleigh Baker: The former innkeeper's life was destroyed by a necromancer, but her existence didn't end.

boardgame.name: Ridley's Games Room: The Name Game Quiz
boardgame.description:
A quick-fire guessing game suitable for all ages. Describe the famous person without using the words on the cards and see just how many your team mates can guess to win the game

Players take a card which lists a famous person and 5 words, titles, etc. which they are identified with. Players describe the famous person without using the words on the cards. Whoever guesses the person wins the card. The team with the most cards at the end of the game, wins.

boardgame.name: Star Fleet Battles Commander's Rulebook Update II
boardgame.description:
A 64-page rulebook expansion for Star Fleet Battles: Commander's Rulebook.

This product was designed to be taken apart and integrated into the previous volumes of the rulebook.

Update #2 includes a compilation of SFB material that had previously appeared in other sources, such as Nexus magazine. Much of this material has been updated and revised for Update #2, and some entirely new material is also included.

boardgame.name: Escape from Earth
boardgame.description:
The Faction needs you! The End is near and you are there, looking at your cell phone, sweetie! They called them conspiranoids, they laughed at them, and the vast majority did not heed the signals, but NOW ITS HERE.

The famous Meteor that everyone has heard of is about to collide with our planet and the Government continues to deny it to avoid chaos. The time has come to decide: Do you accept your fatal destiny or do you rebel and fight to create a new one, safe from Final Destruction? Are you willing to face your friends and family to the last consequences? Steal their resources and boycott their advances? Will you leave them lying at the last minute in order to save your skin? Congratulations. You are the kind of person that Escape From Earth needs!

The player in his turn draws cards and performs actions on the cards in his hand. He can attack another player or draw resource cards from a market. The objective is to obtain cards that have the 5 types of resources.

boardgame.name: Age of Penda: Battle Games In Seventh Century Britain
boardgame.description:
In this gridded-layout miniature wargame, you take the role of a seventh-century warlord or king leading your army on the battlefield. You must choose where and how to focus your warriors' actions and control the battle’s impetus. The battle is partly fought on the tabletop like other miniature wargames but is also fought just as hard on the Tactics Chart, providing an additional mind-game against your opponent.

Command your units to move and fight in the areas of the battlefield you wish, but leave the actual process of fighting to your units' commanders. This is represented by the random factor of dice and each of your units’ abstract but often-decreasing Battle Rating. Because of this, your focus is kept where it should be – out-thinking your opponent by using superior tactics and exploiting their weaknesses on the battlefield.

Age of Penda is not intended as a heavy simulation of medieval warfare but as an enjoyable, simple, and fast-playing battle game themed around seventh-century warfare.

You’ll find that much of the action is stylized and streamlined. Don’t think of “turns” in the usual wargaming way – in each turn your units may fight or move several times, countered by your opponent after every action, creating a very fluid game but at the same time making cohesive planning difficult to achieve.

boardgame.name: Evolution: Climate Board Game
boardgame.description: Evolution Climate is in-app purchaseable downloadable content in the Evolution app.

boardgame.name: Lucky Dog
boardgame.description:
Lucky Dog is a dice game where the dog always wins. There are two ways to play: A free-for-all 2-4 player version, and a 2 player cooperative version.

In the free-for-all version players take turns revealing 5 cards with parameters (such as 3 of a kind, 3 in a row, two pair, etc.) The player rolls 5 six sided dice and then may discard and reveal one new card. The player then gets an opportunity to reroll any of the dice up to twice, trying to fulfill the parameters of as many of the cards as possible. When they are done re-rolling, they take and score any of the revealed cards that the dice fulfill the parameters for. Players take turns in this manner until a player reaches 20 points, then the player with the most points at the end of the round wins.

In the 2 player cooperative version, each player will have 2 hidden cards in their hand. The player who's turn it is rolls all five dice and choose to 'keep' any of the dice, but must choose at least one. The second player takes and rolls any of the un-kept dice, then they can keep any of the dice, but must keep at least one. Players roll dice back and forth like this until all dice are kept. As soon as that happens, both players can score any cards in their hand that the dice meet the parameters for. If the players collectively score at least one card, they may keep playing by drawing up to two cards and starting a new round. If they can't score a card, it's game over with a total score equal to all the cards scored.

boardgame.name: Conquêtes
Erobern!
boardgame.description:
Conquêtes ("Conquests") is a game of world domination and empire building. As generals leading powerful armies, you try to conquer the largest territory — but you must be prepared to fight because your opponents have the same goal.

Each player starts with five cards in hand, and on a turn you take one of three actions:


Draw two cards.
Place a region card from your hand into play face up as long as no one else has already claimed this region.
Attack a region owned by an opponent. Each of you can choose cards from your hand as reinforcements, revealing them at the same time and adding their value to the die on your attacking or defending card. If the attacker has a higher value, they take the card and add it to their holdings; otherwise the defender keeps it.


At game's end, score 1 point for each card that makes up your largest territory and 1 point for each card in your hand that duplicates a card in this territory.

boardgame.name: Bodyguard of Lies - Premiere - Issue 0
boardgame.description:
Bodyguard of Lies was the official newsletter of the Conspiracy X roleplaying game.

This is an eight-page issue staple-bound broadsheet, which includes an editorial, and material covering HERMES downloads, Generic Characters, Missions and Upcoming releases

boardgame.name: LetterTricks
boardgame.description:
LetterTricks is a collection of two trick-taking card games.

The deck consists of 52 cards, but instead of having numbers like most decks, each suit contains letters of the English alphabet. There are three suits, each having all vowels, most common consonants, and two of the rarest consonants.

LetterTricks Cooperative is a 3-5 player cooperative game in which players work together to form a word with each trick. Players must follow suit if they can, and they earn a point for each trick in which a word can be formed by the letters at the end. The highest card of suit led leads the next trick (with Z being the highest letter, and A being the lowest). Perfect scores are possible, but rare.

LetterTricks Competitive is a 3-5 player competitive trick taking game in which winning tricks earns letters from the trick. (In the 4-5 player game, the lowest-ranked card gets to also take a letter from the trick.) At the end of a round, players take the letters they've received from the tricks and use them to form words. Each letter is one point, except for the rarest consonants, which give two points. Players don't need to use all of the letters they earn. A number of rounds equal to the number of players is played, and highest score wins.

listing.notes: New in shrink. Shipping is $5 in a padded envelope, or $8 in a small flat rate box.

boardgame.name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Green Samurai Ranger Super Samurai Mode Promo
boardgame.description:
Cam Watanabe trained for years under his father’s strict tutelage, then received the mystical Samurai Amulet!

Includes an alternate mini depicting the Green Samurai Ranger in Super Samurai Mode.

This accessory requires Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid and the Ranger Allies Pack #2 expansion to play!
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid

boardgame.name: Escape Room: The Game – Puzzle Adventures: The Baron, The Witch & The Thief
boardgame.description:
Your wife has been falsely accused of witchcraft and has been taken away by the Baron's men. Now she is locked up in the castle tower, waiting for her execution. You only have one night to break into the impenetrable fort, find your wife and save her from being burned at the stake. An impossible mission... but fortunately there is help from an unexpected source!

In this cross between an Escape Room and a jigsaw, you explore a medieval castle, and piece by piece, you discover the secrets held within. Play the game at your leisure in Puzzle Mode, or set the timer and go for the best score in Escape Room Mode. Play this game with two or enjoy Escape Room The Game: Puzzle Adventures by yourself!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

listing.notes: Title: Escape Room: The Baron, the Witch & the Thief Puzzle Abenteuer (DE) Publisher: Noris Spiele Language(s): German

boardgame.name: Godzilla Battle: Monster Card Showdown!
boardgame.description:
Godzilla Battle: Monster Card Showdown! is a two-player battle card game based on rock-paper-scissors. Choose one from each of the four popular monsters: "Godzilla," "Mothra," "King Ghidorah," and "Mechagodzilla," and aim to win the battle by utilizing skills and playing cards like a fighting card game.

Similar to the rules of rock-paper-scissors, the success or failure of a match is determined by the choosing of one of the three fighting styles "Goo, Par, Choki" (Rock, Paper, Scissors) written on the card. Keep in mind though that even if you lose the fighting style choice, you can still overcome your opponent and win by utilizing your monster's special abilities. There are a variety of effects monsters have using these special abilities. You'll have to play to find out and master them all!

Let's aim for victory by making full use of powerful techniques!

boardgame.name: February
boardgame.description:
February is a trick-taking game mixed with majorities in which players compete to schedule events at a popular venue.

The deck consists of two each of cards numbered 1-28, with each card representing a day in the month of February (one card is daytime, the other is nightime). Each week (1-7, 8-14, 15-21, 22-28) is a different colored suit. Additional special cards (such as a "Leap Year" card and a "Reschedule" card) are included and worked in based on player count.

Players must follow either the colored suit of the lead card, or the must play a card of the same day of the week. Thus, the "1" card could be followed by either a card of that suit (a 1-7) or another Sunday (the 1st, 8th, 15th, or 22nd).

The highest card played which follows wins the trick (cards not following can't win the trick); in the event of a tie, the nighttime card wins. The winner gets to mark the day on the calendar as theirs; if a marker is already there, it gets replaced. The card winning the trick is removed from the game.

Once a full hand has been played, players shuffle the remaining cards, adding in a pre-determined number of special ability cards, and then play another hand, again competing for calendar space.

Having the most markers in a particular week earns two points; ties are broken by the marker closest to Sunday. Having the most markers on a particular day of the week (i.e. Monday) earns one point; ties are broken by the earliest date. Most points wins; ties are broken by the earliest date.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Het ANWB vakantie spel
boardgame.description:
When going on vacation you do a lot of fun stuff like flying kites, swimming or building sandcastles. But be sure to pick up your beloved items at the ANWB-shop and be the first player to deliver all your items at your vacation home.

Throw the colored die to see how far you can drive your car and strategically place traffic lights to block your opponents roads.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Love Match
boardgame.description:
In Love Match it's all about love, friendship, romance, fun and surprises. Learn new things about love and be smarter than your opponents and be the first one to find your love match.
But it's not only about knowing the most about love. Sometimes you have to complete challenges in order to win hearts.

When it's your turn, throw a dice. Where you land determines what you must do that turn. You can either answer a trivia question about love or friendship. When it's good you stay on your spot, when you answer it wrong you go back to the place you came from. You can get questions about how well you know the other players. Or you can lend on a duel. Where you must try to match the answer that the other player picks. Each time you succeed you will get a heart. If you are the first player to reach the end of the heart shaped track with three hearts you are the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Noordhollands Dagblad spel
boardgame.description:
In this game you play a journalist who tries to collect news stories in different places. The more news you manage to gather, the more ads you will get. And you will need those ads in order to make a complete newspaper.
But beware, not every lead will give you a story worth writing about, sometimes it's a dead end.

On the board you see a map of the province of North Holland. Across you will see roads with different color circles on it When it's your turn you throw a dice and move your pawn that many spaces. On the news article cards you will see the name of the place you have to go to in order to collect them. There are six different categories of news: Regional news, World news, Economics, background stories, Culture and Sports. Each one with their own color. You have to gather an article from every category and four ads in order to win.
The top card from the ad deck lies open for everyone. It shows the required colors of the news categories you need to have in order to get the ad.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Oranienburger Kanal
boardgame.description:
The Oranienburg canal, which gave this game its name, was built between 1832 and 1837 in Brandenburg. The Havel River was difficult to navigate near the Oranienburg mills, so a canal was built from the Havel that crossed the older Ruppin canal, thereby forming the Oranienburg canal cross. During the industrialization in the 19th century, lots of companies and businesses were formed at this important waterway. Moreover, additional streets and railways were built.

In Oranienburger Kanal, you erect new industries and shape the infrastructure by building pathways, streets, railways, and canals. Most important of all are bridges that connect buildings. To do all of this, you have access to various actions that you select in the right moments.

At the end of the game, the player with the best industrial area and the best infrastructure wins.

Oranienburger Kanal also includes a solo game!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Resist!
boardgame.description:
Spain, 1936: General Franco and his troops advance through the territories of Spain, giving way to a long period of civil war and repression. After the Spanish Civil War, a group of loyalists to the Republic continued the armed struggle, forming resistance groups better known as "Maquis". Hidden in the mountains, these men and women risked their lives to defend the ideals of democracy and freedom.

Fighting against them were the Army of Franco, the Civil Guard, and the Armed Police, but the Maquis perfected their guerilla warfare in France during the second World War and were determined to take back their homeland. In the head of each Maquis resonated the echo of the desire of many compatriots: Resist!

Resist! is a fast-playing, card-driven solitaire game in which you take on the role of the Spanish Maquis, fighting against the Francoist regime. Over a series of rounds, you undertake increasingly difficult missions, and completing missions earns you the points needed to win. Failing to defeat missions and enemies may cause you to lose. At the end of each round, you must choose whether to end the resistance or risk it and take on another mission.

At the beginning of the game, you assemble a team of twelve Maquis, which are represented by a deck of cards. At the heart of the game is the tension between keeping your Maquis concealed from Franco or revealing them to unlock their full potential. Unfortunately, revealed Maquis are removed from your deck, and you likely won't be able to use them for the rest of the game. While Resist! does have some minor deck-building elements, it is primarily a "deck-destruction" game in which you have to manage your deck, balancing the decision of defeating the immediate threat with trying to move on to the next mission.

boardgame.name: Mudskipper Dragons
boardgame.description: New amphibious monsters for 5e.

boardgame.name: Conflict of Heroes: Kursk '43 – Nordfront
boardgame.description:
A Missions Expansion for Conflict of Heroes: Storms of Steel – Kursk 1943 (Third Edition)

This expansion is centered on the battle near the towns of Ponyri and Olkhovatka, which both sides considered as vital positions.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Conflict of Heroes: Storms of Steel – Kursk 1943 (Third Edition)

boardgame.name: Star Dragon Rage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The ancient world of Harth withers beneath its dying sun…but it’s not dead yet.

The pastoral village of Kettle nestles on the banks of a strangely warm lake. A few people are missing. A few creatures prowl in the shadows.

Then the cemetery erupts. A stranger reveals that a magnificent city lies hidden below. Wondrous treasures sit forgotten in towers and vaults, but deadly monsters roar in the darkness…and they’re clawing their way up!

ADVENTURE TYPE: Campaign / Low Level / Exploration / Village / Wilderness / City / Subterranean

DESIGN NOTES

This campaign is intended for low-level characters to progress from Level 1/2 to 5/6. Overall, this is designed to offer roughly equal opportunities for exploration, combat, and social encounters. There are many unique magical items and unique monsters. It is not fair or balanced.
Play time depends on how many areas the PCs choose to explore, how complex the NPC interactions are, and whether the players want to revisit areas to see them evolve. Expect this adventure to run for at least 6 and up to 20 sessions.
Players will explore a small village and wilderness, and then a vast underground chasm with a second village, an ancient city, an under-city, and other caves.
There are numerous NPCs as well as unique magical items and original monsters.
This can be a linear adventure, but it is meant to be recursive. PCs are rewarded for returning to earlier locations with new knowledge or items to “unlock” new features. For example, if you find the smith’s master tools, he can make weapons. If you find rare metals, he can make magic weapons. This is meant to encourage the party to become invested in the world, to find all the hidden secrets and to care about how the setting evolves due to their actions.

boardgame.name: Lair of the Dire Hag
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A series of 4 interconnected isometric-style maps forming one large horizontal delve depicting a fantastical lair and what lies within. Great for GMs who enjoy populating their own dungeons and for Players who enjoy seeing what’s around them as their characters explore a wilderness subterranean complex.

Each map is presented separately as a high resolution, full color 8.5x11 page. Ideal for printing and VTT play.

A 28x11 combined map depicting the entire delve is included. There’s also a bonus area map (inside cover) of a boggy woodland setting wherein there is a hole – a maw that marks the entrance to the Lair of the Dire Hag.

boardgame.name: Raven of the Scythe Fantasy Role Playing Game (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Raven of the Scythe is a fantasy RPG that brings you into a world of grim possibilities. It is a world darker than some, but never sacrifices the joy and excitement of classic fantasy role-playing.


Fast and easy play using 2d10 system.



Classless system allows you to build the character you want to play with options available to recreate fantasy archetypes such as Melee fighter, archer, wizard, thief, priest, bard, craftsman, scholar, healer, beastmaster, and more; or build your own unique playstyle based on the choices you make for your character using a combination of attribute, skills, and favors.



Streamlined character creation rules allow you to get into play quickly, while still allowing for a huge variety of character types right out of the gate.



Modular system allows for both rules light characters with little more than their base stats and highly crunchy characters with a plethora of unique talents and abilities to both contribute at the same table.



“Dim-Dark” tone forces players to face exhaustion, lasting injuries, and the constant threat of death, without devolving into depictions of bloody disembowelments or epic gore.



Low magic setting / high magic possibilities allows the party to delve into a world of darkness and superstition regarding arcane forces, and to also master those same forces if they so choose.



Complete Role Playing Experience including rules for; combat, magic, bardic abilities, animal companions, multiple weapons-based fighting styles, priestly powers, item crafting, alchemy, magic items, treasure, and more.



Book of Encounters provides more than 200 monsters, creatures, and supernatural foes to give any party a variety of challenging encounters.
boardgame.rpg: Raven of the Scythe Fantasy Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: The Murder of Modius
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Modius is dead and the whole city of Gary is a suspect!"

The Murder of Modius is a Chronicle for Vampire: The Masquerade 5th Edition made for 2-5 players. It is set in Gary, Indiana where the player characters have been summoned in order to investigate the death of the deeply despised but still powerful Prince. Along the way they will deal with Anarchs, Camarilla, the Second Inquisition, Thin Bloods, and wraiths. They will also discover the shocking motive that ties to the presence of a sleeping methuselah.

Can the players solve this baffling murder? Do they want to?

The Murder of Modius contains:


A complete Chronicle dealing with the death of Gary's Pauper Prince.



A complete write-up of Gary as a setting for Vampire: The Masquerade 5th Edition.



Ten adventure hooks for spicing up the players' experiences in Gary.



Ten SPC write-ups for Gary's Kindred.

boardgame.name: The Path of Draconic Rage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new Barbarian sub-class for 5E that allows you to become the embodiment of the elemental destruction. It is a sub-class that allows you to infuse your blows with elemental power, breathe destructive energies, and eventually become a dragon yourself.

boardgame.name: College of the Cards
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new Bard sub-class for 5E that represents the idea of the soothesayer who divines the future by drawing cards.

Creators Note: This class is very roleplay dependant. not in playing the character, but by the player at the table. If you enjoy the theater of playing out a card reading and the luck of the draw to determine your class abilities for the day, this sub-class will suit you perfectly.

boardgame.name: Memento Mori - Mutus Liber
boardgame.description:
Il Mutus liber è il terzo e ultimo capitolo della saga di Memento Mori.

Questo nuovo volume porta avanti le lancette della storia di qualche anno spostando gli eventi al tramonto della piaga di peste del quattordicesimo secolo. Mentre il morbo inizia a dare segni di cedimento, una nuova minaccia incombe sull'intero vecchio continente. Il Codex Gigas sta infatti per gettare il mondo conosciuto nella più buia delle ere. Come agiranno i Principi della Pentarchia? La loro ricerca dell'Incubo è tutt'altro che dimenticata.

Il Mutus Liber introduce una nuova modalità di gioco chiamata "Il Richiamo". Se con il primo volume era possibile vivere la nascita e le gesta degli Erranti, questo è il momento di partecipare alla loro estinzione. In questo capitolo interpreterete gli Ultori e i Ferali, nuovi personaggi giocabili e terrificanti cacciatori di Erranti.

Il Mutus Liber è anche una raccolta di nove storie brevi che esaltano i drammi legati alla maledizione del Mutus Liber. Scritte da Cristiano Brignola, ognuna di esse è un'ispirazione unica per la creazione delle avventure giocabili attraverso la nuova modalità di gioco.

340 pagine, cartonato effetto tela blu con scritte in fusione oro.

boardgame.name: Memento Mori - Codex Gigas
boardgame.description:
Il CODEX GIGAS rappresenta un approfondimento sull’ambientazione e sulla cosmogonia del gioco di ruolo Memento Mori.

Tuttavia, non si tratta di un prodotto rivolto esclusivamente ai giocatori in possesso del manuale originario, ma è stato anzi scritto e pensato per coinvolgere nuovi lettori interessati a questo immaginario. Può essere letto in entrambe le chiavi di lettura: espansione del gioco o semplice fonte di contenuti sul folclore, la stregoneria e la mitologia medievale.

Il CODEX GIGAS è il racconto in prima persona di un Errante leggendario che, aiutato dalla sua incrollabile fede, ha documentato e catalogato per secoli i territori, i popoli e le creature del mondo Oltre il Velo. I capitoli del Bestiarium, dell'Herbarium, del Lapidarium e del Grimorium custodiscono tutte le conoscenze raccolte in questa oscura epopea.

312 pagine, cartonato effetto tela rossa con scritte in fusione oro.

boardgame.name: John Carter of Mars: Landscape and Location Card Deck
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

John Carter of Mars is a science-fantasy roleplaying game from the mind of Edgar Rice Burroughs. It will transport you to Barsoom, an arid, dying land of ancient civilizations and fearsome creatures. Using a pulp-action inspired variant of the 2d20 System, take on the role of heroes as you travel, battle, and romance your way across the wondrous and dangerous world of Barsoom

Modiphius Entertainment presents the John Carter of Mars Landscape and Location Card Deck. Explore the beautiful, terrifying and wondrous landscapes of the Red Plant with these 52 landscape art cards. With amazing vistas of the plant on the front and evocative, descriptive text on the back, you’ll truly transport your players to Barsoom when you use these to enhance your John Carter of Mars campaigns.

• 52 full colour tarot size cards
• Card fronts feature beautiful artwork of Barsoom's landscapes
• Card backs feature descriptive text to inspire you games.

boardgame.name: キャット＆チョコレート: Gachapin x Mukku (Cat & Chocolate: Gachapin Challenge Edition)
boardgame.description:
キャット＆チョコレート: Gachapin x Mukku (Cat & Chocolate: Gachapin Challenge Edition) is a standalone game that uses the same gameplay as Cat & Chocolate with characters, items, and situations from the children's television programs "Hirake! Ponkikki" and "Ponkickies".

Each turn, the active player must use 1-3 items in hand to avoid threats, creating a convincing story that incorporates these somewhat random objects. After you tell the story, everyone else votes on whether or not you succeeded. If a majority backs you, you keep the threat card; otherwise, you don't. Each player secretly belongs to either the Gachapin or the Mukku team, and you naturally want to vote for the players on your team, but no one knows who is on which team.

After a certain number of threats, the game ends, players reveal which team they belong to, and each team tallies the number of threats that their members escaped. Whichever side avoided more threats wins!

boardgame.name: Ouch!
boardgame.description:
Choose which Cactus card you want to take and decide which side you will handle it by. When you flip it over, you may get a nice set of flowers or an itchy prick in your finger!

Ouch! is a game for the whole family, especially for the younger ones. In this game players will take turns choosing the Cactus card with the prettiest flowers they want to bring over to their collection. Before taking the card they’ll need to indicate which side of the card they will touch, and then flip it handling only that side of the card. If the reverse is clear on that side, they can take the card and score that number of flowers. If the reverse shows a cactus full of thorns, they will lose the card.

As soon as someone manages to keep eight cards (or the deck runs out), players will count the number of flowers they’ve managed to collect. The one with the highest number of flowers in their collection will win the game.

-description from publisher
